replies.author: monica-BTC

timeline.body:
How about using the `getSites()` method on the study? Hibernate already knows how to fetch the studies because you've written them with the ManyToOne, OneToMany relationships. When you call `getSites()` on the App it will construct the appropriate query and fetch corresponding Sites from the database. Don't worry about performance, there are many techniques built into Hibernate that can be used depending on the situation.

I suggest this because it will eliminate a lot of the code you've written in the Service. You are essentially doing a JOIN in Java by separating out the IDs, querying on them, and then combining the results. Doing this in the database is much better and comes for "free" (meaning you don't have to write the code).

Here is some more information about best practices https://thorben-janssen.com/best-practices-many-one-one-many-associations-mappings/

replies.bodyText:
Participant Manager API's and front-end application was already developed as per design document and QA tested internally. Now, team is refactoring the code to address the Areas of Improvements without breaking the functionality and trying to keep the integration issues minimal during this refactoring. Unfortunately, due to project timelines, we'll not be able to change the structure or rename the variables in Response objects.
This applies to similar comments on this PR.
replies.author: dhanyak-btc

replies.bodyText: Let's come back to this in the next track.
replies.author: nikklassen

timeline.body: Can we put this in a `location` property? It will be easier for the frontend to create interfaces if they can always use the same `Location`. Otherwise their code needs to extract all of the location-related properties out and map them back into a location object.
timeline.bodyText: Can we put this in a location property? It will be easier for the frontend to create interfaces if they can always use the same Location. Otherwise their code needs to extract all of the location-related properties out and map them back into a location object.

replies.bodyText: allowedFields is added to fix @saminguyen review comment. I am returning bad request if fields contains invalid value.
replies.author: monica-BTC

replies.bodyText:
This is still consistent with what Sami was saying. I'm talking about only the case when the value of fields is empty, you can set fields to {"studies", "sites"}. (exactly what you're doing with DEFAULT, just with "" instead).
This is of course assuming that appService.getAppsWithOptionalFields(userId, {"studies", "sites"}) is the same as calling appService.getApps(userId)
replies.author: nikklassen

replies.bodyText: Have fixed the review comment. Both methods returns different responses, in getApps() we calculate enrollment percentage etc., for dashboard screen and getAppsWithOptionalFields() does not calculate enrollment percentage, it returns studies and sites for the apps.
replies.author: monica-BTC

timeline.body: Is `CollectionUtils.emptyIfNull` necessary? It's not clear from the docs but I would think `findAll()` will always return a list, it just might be empty if there's nothing to fetch.

replies.bodyText: Yes, it returns empty list. I verified it by calling findAll() in @BeforeEach. I'll inform the team not to use CollectionUtils.emptyIfNull for findAll().

timeline.body:
```suggestion
                        StudyMapper.toAppStudyResponse(
                            study, study.getSites(), fields))
```
You don't need to build the whole list of sites out in `getAppsWithOptionalFields` (line 278)
timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                                    StudyMapper.toAppStudyResponse(
          
          
            
                                        study, groupByStudyIdSiteMap.get(study.getId()), fields))
          
          
            
                                    StudyMapper.toAppStudyResponse(
          
          
            
                                        study, study.getSites(), fields))
          
      
    
    
  

You don't need to build the whole list of sites out in getAppsWithOptionalFields (line 278)
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
StudyMapper.toAppStudyResponse(
study, groupByStudyIdSiteMap.get(study.getId()), fields))
StudyMapper.toAppStudyResponse(
study, study.getSites(), fields))

You don't need to build the whole list of sites out in getAppsWithOptionalFields (line 278)
